intro: Styphelia elatior, commonly known as the tall greenish heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially sunny conditions. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually pink or white, adding ornamental value to gardens. Styphelia elatior is often found in moist, rocky habitats such as pine woodlands and scrublands.
